name: CEDRIC KUSHNER PROMOTIONS, LTD. v. KING
reasoningForIncluding: The case concerns a claim that a corporate employee is the 'person' and the corporation is the 'enterprise'.

name: Riverwoods Chappaqua Corp. v. Marine Midland Bank, N. A.
reasoningForIncluding: The Second Circuit relied on earlier Circuit precedent for its decision in the CEDRIC KUSHNER PROMOTIONS, LTD. v. KING case.

name: Anatian v. Coutts Bank (Switzerland) Ltd.
reasoningForIncluding: The Second Circuit's other precedent also involved significantly different allegations compared with the instant case.

name: Discon, Inc. v. NYNEX Corp.
reasoningForIncluding: The Second Circuit's other precedent also involved significantly different allegations compared with the instant case.

name: Bennett v. United States
reasoningForIncluding: The Second Circuit's other precedent also involved significantly different allegations compared with the instant case.

name: United States v. Turkette
reasoningForIncluding: This Court has held that RICO both protects a legitimate 'enterprise' from those who would use unlawful acts to victimize it.

name: National Organizationf or Women, Inc. v. Scheidler
reasoningForIncluding: This Court has held that RICO also protects the public from those who would unlawfully use an 'enterprise' as a 'vehicle' through which 'unlawful . . . activity is committed.'

name: Reves v. Ernst & Young
reasoningForIncluding: This Court has stated that an enterprise is 'operated' within ยง 1962(c)'s meaning, 'not just by upper management but also by lower rung participants in the enterprise who are under the direction of upper management.'

name: Copperweld Corp. v. Independence Tube Corp.
reasoningForIncluding: The alternative that the Court endorsed is no less consistent with the principle that antitrust law's intracorporate conspiracy doctrine turns on specific antitrust objectives.
